abstract: Blue Cross and Blue Shield Assn study finds policyholders newly insured under Affordable Care Act use more, and more expensive medical services than those Americans who were already covered by insurance; findings seem to support need for insurers to seek significant rate increases.
lead_paragraph: To the Obama administration, the new data is seen as evidence that there has been pent-up demand for the policy signed into law by the president.

headline.main: Newest Policyholders Under Health Law Are Sicker and Costlier to Insurers
headline.print_headline: Policyholders Under Law Prove Sicker and Costlier

snippet: To the Obama administration, the new data is seen as evidence that there has been pent-up demand for the policy signed into law by the president.
